private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D only (A is smallest, D is largest among my disks).
I must only move a disk if it is currently the top disk on its peg.
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the final configuration: left peg (top->bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) A; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I can move disks E, F, G only (E is smallest among my disks, G largest).
I must only move a disk if it is currently the top disk on its peg.
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the final configuration: left peg (top->bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) A; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I can move disks H, I, J only (H is smallest among my disks, J largest).
I must only move a disk if it is currently the top disk on its peg.
agent_3.goal: Help achieve the final configuration: left peg (top->bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) A; right peg (top->bottom) C.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move sequences and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that models the 3-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and yields the ordered primitive moves to reach the stated goal while keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg contains disks top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top->bottom B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top->bottom A; right peg top->bottom C.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents have disk-moving restrictions: each agent may only move the disks listed in its private information.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 responsible for moving a subset of disks. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from <peg> to <peg>' where <peg> is one of left, middle, right. Do not emit PDDL. Only list moves you can legally perform given the public Tower of Hanoi rules and your private disk permissions. Each move must respect that only the top disk of a peg can be moved and you must not place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Provide the minimal necessary moves you will perform to help reach the global goal given your knowledge.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, using only the disks you are allowed to move. Each line should be a single move in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. If you cannot determine a safe move because of missing information, list no moves.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 responsible for moving a subset of disks. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from <peg> to <peg>' where <peg> is one of left, middle, right. Do not emit PDDL. Only list moves you can legally perform given the public Tower of Hanoi rules and your private disk permissions. Each move must respect that only the top disk of a peg can be moved and you must not place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Provide the minimal necessary moves you will perform to help reach the global goal given your knowledge.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, using only the disks you are allowed to move. Each line should be a single move in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. If you cannot determine a safe move because of missing information, list no moves.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 responsible for moving a subset of disks. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from <peg> to <peg>' where <peg> is one of left, middle, right. Do not emit PDDL. Only list moves you can legally perform given the public Tower of Hanoi rules and your private disk permissions. Each move must respect that only the top disk of a peg can be moved and you must not place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Provide the minimal necessary moves you will perform to help reach the global goal given your knowledge.
moves.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, using only the disks you are allowed to move. Each line should be a single move in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not output PDDL. If you cannot determine a safe move because of missing information, list no moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the move lists produced by the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Model the three agents distinctly by prefixing or otherwise distinguishing their allowed actions so the solver can attribute moves to agents. Ensure the PDDL respects standard Tower of Hanoi rules, models pegs and disks, encodes agent-specific move permissions, and encodes the initial and goal configurations. The produced PDDL should be compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Agent inputs: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Reconcile the agents' move lists, detect and resolve any conflicts, and output a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that capture the full instance and can be solved by FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep each agent's actions distinct in the domain and problem so it is clear which agent can perform which move.
